Toby, your shedding is still in the worsening window, and your body hasn’t hit stabilization yet. Because late coffee cuts into your already short 6 hours of sleep, your cortisol stays higher through the night. That extra stress signal keeps more follicles stuck in “shedding mode.” Setting a caffeine cut‑off is the single lever that helps you slide into deeper sleep, flatten stress hormones, and move from the peak of loss into stabilization 🌙.

What to do

  • Keep all caffeine before 2 pm — coffee, tea, energy drinks.
  • Stick to a max of 2 cups in the first half of the day.
  • Switch to decaf/herbal after lunch if you want the ritual.
  • Pair your last caffeine with food to soften any jitters.

Your recommended schedule

  • Wake: set a fixed anchor (e.g. 7:00 am) daily.
  • Bedtime: aim 11:00 pm latest → 8h sleep window.
  • No caffeine past 2:00 pm to protect deep sleep cycles.
  • Last meal: 2–3h before bed if possible, to avoid night wake‑ups.

Step-by-step implementation

  1. Notice when you currently crave your “afternoon boost.”
  2. Shift that cup to before 1:45 pm this week.
  3. Keep a decaf/herbal option ready for the 3–5 pm slump.
  4. Pair caffeine with protein at breakfast/lunch to stabilize energy.
  5. Set a gentle reminder alarm at 2 pm: “Caffeine cut‑off.”

Why this works (for you)

  • Your high stress + late caffeine = elevated night cortisol → follicle exit. Cutting off earlier lowers that signal so hairs stop prematurely shedding.
  • Your worst trigger (major illness Jan–May) means lagged fallout now. By protecting sleep now, you shorten the time to stabilization, so regrowth can start on schedule.
  • Anxiety/rumination are less intense when sleep deepens, giving your system more repair hormones (progesterone, thyroid signals) that encourage stronger regrowth.

What to look out for

  • Red flags: If you push caffeine later “just this once,” expect more tossing at night → notice extra shedding 1–2 days later; reset quickly.
  • Green lights: Within 7–10 days you wake less groggy, fall asleep faster, and notice fewer “clumps” on wash days.
  • Remember — this is about protecting your sleep like a shield 🌱. Small, steady shifts matter more than perfection.
